title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. IX, pt. 215 - Advertisements Of Accident And Health Insurance
content:

§ 215.1 - Purpose
§ 215.2 - Applicability
§ 215.3 - Definitions

§ 215.5 - Form and content of advertisements
§ 215.6 - Advertisements of benefits payable, losses covered or premiums payable
§ 215.7 - Necessity for disclosing policy provisions relating to renewability, cancellability and termination
§ 215.8 - Testimonials or endorsements by third parties
§ 215.9 - Use of statistics
§ 215.10 - Identification of plan or number of policies
§ 215.11 - Disparaging comparisons and statements
§ 215.12 - Jurisdictional licensing and status of insurer
§ 215.13 - Identity of insurer
§ 215.14 - Group or quasi-group implications
§ 215.15 - Introductory, initial or special offers
§ 215.16 - Statements about an insurer
§ 215.17 - Enforcement procedures
§ 215.18 - Severability provision

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. IX, pt. 215

Statutory authority: Insurance Law, §§ 21, 174-a, 201, 273, 301, 3201, 3216, 3217, 3218, 3221, 3231, 3232, 4235, art. 43; Federal

Social Security Act, 42 U.S.C., §
1395
ss

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
